clusters.name: Knowledge Socialization
clusters.narrative: Individuals with diverse knowledge backgrounds come together and share experiences through direct interaction. Tacit knowledge is transferred through observation, imitation, and practice as newcomers learn from experienced members. This process creates shared mental models and establishes the foundation for community identity and practice.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how individuals learn through observation and modeling within social contexts

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Shared experiences and tacit understanding flow into the externalization process
Receives guidance and established practices from core community members

clusters.name: Knowledge Externalization
clusters.narrative: Tacit knowledge gained through socialization is articulated and converted into explicit concepts. This involves dialogue, reflection, and the creation of shared language and frameworks. Participants move from peripheral understanding to more central participation as they contribute to the community's knowledge base through documentation, models, and formal expressions.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain the progression from peripheral to central participation and knowledge articulation

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives tacit knowledge and shared experiences from socialization process
Articulated explicit knowledge flows into combination and integration
Externalization success influences community identity and participation levels

clusters.name: Knowledge Combination
clusters.narrative: Explicit knowledge from multiple sources is systematically combined, organized, and integrated into coherent knowledge systems. This involves connecting different concepts, categorizing information, and building comprehensive frameworks. The community's knowledge base grows as individual contributions are synthesized and made accessible to all members.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how individual knowledge becomes organizational knowledge through systematic combination

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives articulated explicit knowledge from externalization process
Organized knowledge systems flow into internalization for practical application
Receives community standards and validation criteria for knowledge integration

clusters.name: Knowledge Internalization
clusters.narrative: Organized knowledge is learned, applied, and embodied through practice and experimentation. Individuals transform explicit knowledge back into tacit understanding through hands-on application and reflection. This process deepens expertise and creates new practical insights that can feed back into the knowledge spiral.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how knowledge becomes embodied through concrete experience and reflection

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives organized knowledge systems from combination process
New tacit knowledge from application feeds back into socialization for sharing
Internalized expertise contributes to community capability and identity

clusters.name: Community Core Development
clusters.narrative: The community establishes its identity, norms, and core membership through sustained practice and knowledge sharing. Legitimate peripheral participation enables newcomers to gradually move toward the center as they demonstrate competence and commitment. Core members maintain community standards, mentor newcomers, and steward the community's knowledge assets.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how community identity forms and influences participation patterns

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Provides guidance and established practices to socialization process
Community identity influences knowledge articulation and sharing behaviors
Provides community standards for knowledge validation and integration
Receives contributions to community capability from internalization process

clustering_strategy.overall_narrative: The knowledge creation system begins with Knowledge Socialization where individuals share experiences and build shared understanding through direct interaction [Process 1]. This foundation of tacit knowledge flows into Knowledge Externalization [overlap: Process 1→2] where participants articulate their understanding and move toward more central participation. The articulated explicit knowledge then enters Knowledge Combination [overlap: Process 2→3] where it is systematically organized and integrated into coherent knowledge systems. These organized systems flow into Knowledge Internalization [overlap: Process 3→4] where knowledge is applied, embodied, and transformed back into new tacit understanding. Throughout this spiral, Community Core Development [Process 5] provides the social context that shapes participation patterns and maintains community standards. Critical feedback loops connect later processes to earlier ones: new insights from internalization [feedback: Process 4→1] enrich socialization, while community identity [connections: Process 5→2,3] influences how knowledge is articulated and combined. This creates a continuous knowledge spiral where each process feeds into and enriches the others, with community development serving as the stabilizing force that enables sustained knowledge creation and sharing.
